intro: Urostigma euneuon, commonly known as the narrowleaf bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces distinctive pods that contain several seeds, typical of the mustard family. Urostigma euneuon is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
